titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to St. Lawrence Seaway Collection
titlestmt.author: Erie Canal Museum

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nysyecm.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Reports, maps, news articles and pamphlets related to the St. Lawrence Seaway Power Project.

accessrestrict.p: The Collection is open for research use.

bioghist.p: This collection originally belonged to Howard S. Gay, Civil Engineer, North Atlantic Division, who worked on the St. Lawrence Seaway project.
The St. Lawrence Seaway is a system of locks, canals, and channels extending from Montreal to Lake Erie, which was constructed during the 1950s.

scopecontent.p: Various reports, maps, news articles, and pamphlets related to the St. Lawrence Seaway and Power Project. Reports are by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Massena, NY. Also included are some handwritten notes by Howard Gay.

userestrict.p: The museum is providing access to these materials for personal, educational, and research purposes only. Prior permission from the Erie Canal Museum is required for any other use.
